definition: to cover all at one glance (idiom)/a panoramic view
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: A few days later the weather finally cleared, revealing a completely white north face.
sentences.chinese: 數日後，天氣轉好，白雪皚皚的整個北壁一覽無餘。

sentences.english: But his famous impatience is still close to thesurface.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他那著名的急脾氣，仍一覽無餘。

sentences.english: Boiled in the sun, so that more and more sweeping views of the Gobi.
sentences.chinese: 白灼的陽光，令戈壁越發一覽無餘。

sentences.english: The top view, Taylor's plain, Wen River flow, take in everything in a glance.
sentences.chinese: 山頂遠望，泰萊平原，汶河西流，一覽無餘。

sentences.english: Sitting by the window as the lights turns on, you can keep the wonderful view of the bund.
sentences.chinese: 華燈初上，臨窗而坐，整個外灘的景色一覽無餘。
